javadoc: Associates objects with long index ranges.

methods.javadoc:
Returns an {@link IndexRangeIterator} over all ranges that have associated objects.
@return an {@link IndexRangeIterator} over all ranges that have associated objects.
methods.name: getIndexRangeIterator
methods.comment: Returns an IndexRangeIterator over all ranges that have associated objects.

return.comment: an IndexRangeIterator over all ranges that have associated objects.

methods.name: getIndexRangeIterator
methods.comment:
Returns an IndexRangeIterator over all ranges that have associated objects within
 the given range.  Object Ranges that overlap the beginning or end of the given range are
 included, but have thier start or end index adjusted to be in the given range.

params.name: start
params.comment: the first index in the range to find all index ranges that have associated values.

params.name: end
params.comment:
the last index(inclusive) in the range to find all index ranges that have associated
  values.

return.comment:
an IndexRangeIterator over all ranges that have associated objects within the
 given range.

methods.name: setObject
methods.comment:
Associates the given object with all indices in the given range. The object may be null,
 but an assocition is still established.  Use the clearRange() method to remove associations.

params.name: object
params.comment: the object to associate with the given range.

methods.name: clearRange
methods.comment: Clears any object associations within the given range.

params.name: start
params.comment: the first index in the range to be cleared.

params.name: end
params.comment: the last index in the range to be cleared.

methods.name: contains
methods.comment:
Returns true if the associated index has an associated object even if the assocated object
 is null.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index to check for an association.

return.comment:
true if the associated index has an associated object even if the assocated object
 is null.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the object associated with the given index or null if no object is associated with
 the given index.  Note that null is a valid association so a null result could be either
 no association or an actual association of the index to null.  Use the contains() method
 first if the distinction is important.  If the contains() method returns true, the result
 is cached so the next call to getObject() will be fast.
@param index the index at which to retrieve an assocated object.
@return the object (which can be null) associated with the given index or null if no such
 association exists.
methods.name: getObject
methods.comment:
Returns the object associated with the given index or null if no object is associated with
 the given index.  Note that null is a valid association so a null result could be either
 no association or an actual association of the index to null.  Use the contains() method
 first if the distinction is important.  If the contains() method returns true, the result
 is cached so the next call to getObject() will be fast.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index at which to retrieve an assocated object.

return.comment:
the object (which can be null) associated with the given index or null if no such
 association exists.

name: ObjectRangeMap
comment: Associates objects with long index ranges.
